item.description: Does Red Dead Online's first update really do all that much to fix what so much of the early user base was complaining about?
item.content:encoded:
Yesterday, Red Dead Online got its first major update after being in beta for more than a week. In a post on their newswire, Rockstar said the changes were  "specifically geared towards creating a more balanced, fun and rewarding overall experience, across all modes and missions," so of course, the big question is: does the update really do all that much to fix what so much of RDO's early user base was complaining about? The short answer is yes, it makes a huge difference - even if it doesn't fix all of the beta's problems.

item.title: Joker in Smash Is ‘Emblematic’ of DLC Character Approach
item.description: Nintendo of America COO Reggie Fils-Aime says Joker should prime fans for the type of characters to expect from upcoming DLC.
item.content:encoded:
On the heels of last night’s announcement that Persona 5 protagonist Joker will join the Smash Bros. Ultimate roster, Nintendo of America COO Reggie Fils-Aime says this reveal should prime fans for the type of characters to expect from the rest of the DLC.

“It's emblematic of the approach that Mr. Sakurai and the team are taking with the DLC,” Fils-Aime told IGN. “He wants characters that are unique, different, to bring them into the Smash Bros. environment. So it's going to be tremendously exciting.”

Fils-Aime explained that Sakurai and the team working on Ultimate’s DLC don’t necessarily see characters from franchises not typically associated with Nintendo as a limiting factor when it comes to Smash Bros.

item.description: The Anthem developer revealed when you'll get your first shot piloting a Javelin and how to get in.
item.content:encoded:
Update 12/7: BioWare has given an update to when the demo for Anthem will be released, giving more specific time frames for when fans can expect to play it.

Announced on EA’s website, there will be two release dates for the demo: one for “VIP” players, and an open demo soon after. The VIP demo will run from January 25–27 and be available to those who pre-order Anthem or are an EA Access or Origin Access subscriber at the time of the demo. Those who participate will also get an exclusive VIP demo item.

The open demo will run from February 1-3 on PS4, Xbox One and PC and will be open to all players.

item.title: Who Is SonicFox, the esports Champion Who Stole the Show at The Game Awards?
item.description: Here's what you need to know about SonicFox, the esports champion who stole the show at The Game Awards.
item.content:encoded:
"I'm gay, black, a furry - pretty much everything a Republican hates - and the best esports player of the year, I guess."

With an acceptance speech like that, it's no surprise that people might be wondering who Dominique "SonicFox" McLean is. The short answer is that the winner of Best Esports Player at the 2018 Game Awards is an absolute fighting game machine. The four-time EVO champion has destroyed his competition in games like Injustice: God's Among Us, Mortal Kombat X, and more recently Dragon Ball FighterZ. And he's done it all while sporting a set of blue ears.

One of the most notable things about SonicFox, compared to other esports champions, is his ability to not only flex into other games but to dominate in them. He also has a tendency to play large character pools or even stick to those often considered weaker like his Joker choice for Injustice 2. At only 20 years old, he's one of the most successful players of all time, and is commonly believed to currently be the highest-paid fighting game esports champ around.

item.title: Devil May Cry 5: New Character Details Revealed
item.description: Capcom has released an extended trailer for Devil May Cry 5, and has given more information on the new character V.
item.content:encoded:
Devil May Cry 5 received a brief new trailer during The Game Awards last night, but Capcom has released an extended trailer and more information on the new character V.

V is touted as a deceptively strong character that can summon three different demons to assist him in battle. Shadow is a fast, panther-like creature that can morph into blades and needles for close-range combat. Griffon is a bird-like demon that can carry V across large areas and fire beams of light to destroy incoming enemies. Nightmare is a massive demon that crushes enemies that get in his path, and can also utilize beams of light.

Using all three demons to your advantage, V can enter battle after enemy health has been whittled down to make a final blow with his cane attack. V and his demons can be seen in action in the extended trailer below.

item.title: The Outer Worlds Is Bringing Fun Back to Science Fiction
item.description: Obsidian's newly announced Sci-Fi RPG has a dark sense of humor slathering its corporate world.
item.content:encoded:
Obsidian is no stranger to good roleplaying games. For more than a decade the developer behind Star Wars: Knights of the Old Republic 2, Fallout: New Vegas, the Pillars of Eternity series, and more has delivered the kind of strange and fantastical worlds where players can get lost saving the world, or dooming it. Now, the studio is back at it again with a new sci-fi slice of fresh hell to get lost in: The Outer Worlds.

The Outer Worlds is something new for Obsidian. It’s not concerned with dragons and elves, or post-apocalyptic desert bugs and raiders. There are no Jedi (that I know of.)

item.title: Earth Defense Force 5 Review
item.description: Even with dated graphics, EDF 5 is an energetic essay on action game design that is way too much fun to miss.
item.content:encoded:
In real life, I don’t like creepy crawly things. I’m terrified of spiders, appalled by roaches, scared stupid of wasps, and refuse to touch any animal that might be deemed “slimy.” My wife kills all the bugs in our house. That fear adds a little gravity and catharsis to fighting the thousands of house-sized monstrosities in EDF 5 – and “thousands” is no hyperbole. During my playthrough of Earth Defense Force 5, I have thus far killed precisely 21,369 space aliens, murderous robots, and giant insects. I know this because the record-keeping department of the Earth Defense Force tells me so, and yet somehow even that astronomical number seems far too low for the amount of satisfaction I’ve derived from it – even before jumping into the excellent co-op multiplayer.

item.title: Far Cry New Dawn: Making the Apocalypse Great Again
item.description: Far Cry New Dawn sets the series after a nuclear apocalypse and it's never look so inviting.
item.content:encoded:
Set 17 years after the climax of Far Cry 5 – which, if you’re not aware, saw Joseph Seed’s religious cult detonate a series of nuclear warheads around the Northern hemisphere – Far Cry New Dawn carves out another story of uprising and resistance amidst the fallout.

Yes, Far Cry’s latest entry is set in a post-apocalyptic world, but crucially, it’s one that’s trying to resist all the cliches that setting might suggest.

A lot of what you might expect from the apocalypse has already passed. The US has endured a long and brutal nuclear winter, where nothing grew and almost everything died. Nearly two decades later, nature has enthusiastically reclaimed what humankind lost – New Dawn presents the most lush and inviting apocalypse imaginable.

item.title: Fortnite's The Block Will Feature Player Creations in Battle Royale
item.description: The Block is a new area in Fortnite Battle Royale and will feature user created buildings and creations.
item.content:encoded:
A new area named The Block has been added to the Fortnite Battle Royale map and will feature user created structures and creations.

Creative Director Donald Mustard shared the news on stage during today's Game Awards presentation. The Block will feature player maps made in Creative, the brand new mode where players can build and customize their own private island. Epic will ultimately pick which creations are featured.

Not every private island will be eligible for The Block. User creations must fit neatly into a 25x25 tile area within the flat section of the island. Memory usage must be kept below 50,000 and chest, floor loot, and vehicle spawns will be added by Epic.

item.title: Magic The Gathering Esports Program Announced at The Game Awards 2018
item.description: Hasbro and Wizards of the Coast announced a new esports program for Magic: The Gathering at The Game Awards 2018.
item.content:encoded:
Hasbro and Wizards of the Coast announced a new esports program for Magic: The Gathering at The Game Awards 2018.

The program, which is coming in 2019, includes a $10 million prize bool across digital and tabletop Magic contests, with a $1 million Mythic Invitational at PAX East 2019. The Magic Pro League (MPL)  will establish a “new level of professional play” with 32 of the top ranked magic players worldwide. MPL players are offered play and streaming contracts worth $75,000, and members will play in weekly match-ups on Magic: The Gathering Arena.

The Mythic Champion events are new flagship competitions for Magic: The Gathering Arena and tabletop Magic, which feature MPL players battling against challengers from the Magic community. More details on how players can enter and climb the ranks to battle these MPL players will be revealed in 2019.

item.content:encoded:
PUBG is getting its first 6x6 map, the snowy Vikendi, as well as a new assault rife and brand new Snowmobile.

Announced at The Game Awards, Vikendi is filled with snow, meaning players fighting for their chicken dinner will have to pay attention to their footprints as they trek through the wintry new map, as they can potentially lead others to their location.

Vikendi will be available tonight on PC Test Server, and will launch on PC Live Server on December 19.

Xbox One and PlayStation 4 owners will be able to try out the new map in January 2019.

item.title: Atlas: ARK: Survival Evolved Dev Announces New Game
item.description: The open-world fantasy pirate MMO comes to PC next week, followed by an Xbox One release in 2019.
item.content:encoded:
Atlas, the next game from the developers of ARK: Survival Evolved, was announced tonight during The Game Awards.

The open-world survival MMO will be released on PC via Steam on December 13, before coming to Xbox One in 2019 through Microsoft's Xbox Game Preview program.

Atlas is developed by Grapeshot Games, a sister studio of ARK developer Studio Wildcard.

Grapeshot Games describes Atlas as a "fantasy pirate adventure," promising shipbuilding, sailing, PvP battles, exploration, a vast skill tree, and a wide variety of creatures ranging from shoulder-mounted parrots to "gigantic sea monsters of legend." The developer also claims Atlas will support up to 40,000 players simultaneously.

The Last Campfire is described as an adventure, telling the story of a lost Ember searching for meaning and a way home. It’s said to be filled with lost folk, strange creatures and mysterious ruins set in a beautiful wilderness. The trailer shows the player walking, rowing and climbing on their journey home.

The developer is calling it a “Hello Games Short,” which, much like a Pixar short film, is designed to foster creativity and strengthen new voices within the studio on smaller titles. In this case, the creatives behind LostWinds joined Hello Games to create this passion project.

item.title: Dauntless Announced for PS4, Xbox One, Switch and Mobile
item.description: The online action-RPG Dauntless is officially coming to PlayStation 4, Xbox One, Nintendo Switch and mobile devices.
item.content:encoded:
The online action-RPG Dauntless is officially coming to PlayStation 4, Xbox One, Nintendo Switch and mobile devices.

Announced at The Game Awards 2018, developer Phoenix Labs shared the news in a new trailer, revealing that the PS4 and Xbox one versions of the game will launch in April, and will become available on the Epic Games Store that same month. The Switch and mobile versions will come sometime later in 2019. The developer also revealed its “One Dauntless” initiative, providing cross-platform play, progression and account management across all of these devices, worldwide.

Dauntless’ newest major content update, Frostfall, is being released today, bringing seasonal content like deep freeze descends on Ramsgate, and Slayers receiving a “chilling challenge” with the introduction of the new behemoth Valomyr. The Dauntless Hunt Pass was also launched today, providing players with new challenges, in-game activities, exclusive items and more for $10 USD.

item.title: Obsidian Announces New Sci-Fi RPG The Outer Worlds
item.description: Set in a far-off colony on the brink of corporate collapse, Obsidian's new single-player RPG is a dark, humorous science fiction shooter.
item.content:encoded:
Today during The Game Awards, developer Obsidian Entertainment and publisher Private Division have announced The Outer Worlds, a new single-player, sci-fi RPG for Xbox One, PS4, and PC coming in 2019.

Set on a colony at the edge of the galaxy where corporations have taken over every aspect of life, your character awakens from hibernation in the midst of a conspiracy that threatens the survival of the colony on the brink of collapse.

As a true single-player RPG, you can build your character into several different playstyles, choose and manage your companions, and drive the story through your decision making, branching dialog, and the actions you take.

The Outer Worlds appears to be a bleak take on commercialism run amok with a strong undercurrent of dark humor throughout the setting and characters.

The Dread Wolf is a reference to an elven deity in the Dragon Age lore, named Fen'Harel, who as it turns out is actually the player's companion Solas.

Crash Team Racing Nitro-Fueled will be released on June 21, 2019 for PS4, Xbox One, and Nintendo Switch, Activision confirmed at The Game Awards following an orange dice-fueled tease earlier this week.

Nitro-Fueled is developed by Spider-Man: Shattered Dimensions devs Beenox Interactive and brings back all the original content from the original PlayStation's CTR, built from the ground up with new visuals and audio. All characters, tracks, and arenas will return, with Adventure, Arcade Single and Cup Race, Time Trials, and Battle modes all returning. Nitro-Fueled will also feature online multiplayer for these modes.

item.title: Ubisoft Reveals Far Cry New Dawn
item.description: Ubisoft has revealed what happened to the world after Far Cry 5 ended with the upcoming entry, New Dawn.
item.content:encoded:
At The Game Awards tonight, Ubisoft announced a standalone sequel to Far Cry 5 titled Far Cry New Dawn.

Set 17 years after a global nuclear disaster, Far Cry New Dawn drops players into a beautiful yet transformed Hope County, Montana – the primary setting of Far Cry 5.

The player will be cast in the role of a survivor facing an entirely new threat in the form of the Highwaymen, a band of scavengers, led by The Twins, Mickey and Lou – the main antagonists of New Dawn.

Players will be tasked with mounting a resistance and strengthening the Survivors camp, who live in a base known as Prosperity. This is where players will be able craft ramshackle weapons and vehicles and recruit new Guns for Hire, which are said to include "new and familiar faces". But more intriguingly, this will also be where players access 'Expeditions', which for the first time in the series take players beyond the core map. These Expeditions are said to take place in "memorable locations across the US, from wetlands to canyons and more".

item.title: Marvel Ultimate Alliance 3: The Black Order Announced For Switch
item.description: Marvel Ultimate Alliance 3: The Black Order was just announced for a 2019 release, exclusively for Switch.
item.content:encoded:
Marvel Ultimate Alliance 3: The Black Order was just announced for a 2019 release, exclusively for the Nintendo Switch, at the Game Awards.

The third entry in the action RPG series was announced with a trailer, which showed off featured characters like the Hulk, Spider-Man, the Guardians of the Galaxy and Wolverine fighting against enemies like Green Goblin, the Sentinels and many more. It features a new top-down view and will be developed by Koei Tecmo Games and Team Ninja and published by Nintendo.

Per a press release, Marvel Ultimate Alliance 3: The Black Order will bring together familiar heroes and villains across the Marvel Universe to battle for the Infinity Gauntlet. "This unprecedented team of characters must use their unique superpowers to defeat the mad cosmic tyrant Thanos and his ruthless warmasters, The Black Order."

item.title: The Stanley Parable: Ultra Deluxe Coming to Consoles, PC in 2019
item.description: The Stanley Parable: Ultra Deluxe comes to consoles and PC in 2019 with all-new content and endings.
item.content:encoded:
The Stanley Parable is coming to consoles in 2019 as The Stanley Parable: Ultra Deluxe.

This new version of The Stanley Parable will feature new content, new choices, and new endings. It'll also come bundled with the original game.

The Stanley Parable: Ultra Deluxe will be released for both PC and consoles, though specific platforms were not announced.

The Stanley Parable was originally released on PC in 2013. IGN's review called it "witty, unusual and quietly discomfiting."

Jordan is a freelance writer for IGN.

item.title: Device 6 Dev Announces Nintendo Switch Game Sayonara Wild Hearts
item.description: At the Game Awards 2018, Device 6 developer Simogo and Annapurna Interactive announced Sayonara Wild Hearts for the Nintendo Switch.
item.content:encoded:
At the Game Awards 2018, Device 6 developer Simogo and Annapurna Interactive announced Sayonara Wild Hearts for the Nintendo Switch.

Described as a "Pop Album Video Game," Sayonara Wild Hearts is a stylistic music-based game featuring characters based on tarot cards, with names such as Dancing Devils, Howling Moons, Stereo Lovers, Hermit64, Little Death, and The Fool.

Sayonara Wild Hearts features everything from riding motorcycles and skateboards, wielding swords, fighting three-headed wolves and more.

Featuring a custom-written vocal pop soundtrack that was designed to complement the gameplay, Sayonara Wild Hearts focuses on "synthesizing electric pop, dance, fashion, anime, arcade games and subcultures, and much more."

item.title: Journey to the Savage Planet Announced at The Game Awards
item.description: Journey to the Savage Planet, the debut title from Typhoon Studios, has been announced at The Game Awards 2018 and will be coming to the Xbox One, PlayStation 4 and PC in 2019.
item.content:encoded:
Journey to the Savage Planet, the debut title from Typhoon Studios, has been announced at The Game Awards 2018 and will be coming to the Xbox One, PlayStation 4 and PC in 2019.

An “upbeat first-person adventure game” set in a vibrant alien world, the player assumes the role of a Kindred Aerospace employee, which is the “4th Best Interstellar Exploration Company.” Players will explore an uncharted planet on the far corners of the universe: with no real plan and little equipment, players will have to explore, catalogue alien lifeforms and determine if the planet is fit for human habitation.

Typhoon Studios is a Montreal-based team comprised of various industry veterans, including Alex Hutchinson (Far Cry 4, Assassin’s Creed 3), Yassine Riahi and Reid Schneider (Batman: Arkham Origins).

item.title: Counter-Strike: Global Offensive Is Now Free-To-Play, Battle Royale Mode Added
item.description: Counter-Strike: Global Offensive is officially free-to-play on PC and Mac, and a new, smaller scale battle royale mode has been added.
item.content:encoded:
Counter-Strike: Global Offensive is officially free-to-play on PC and Mac, and a new, smaller scale battle royale mode has been added.

Announced through counter-strike.net, the mode is called Danger Zone, and is played by 16 players at a time (this can go up to 18 if players queue as a squad of two or three). This battle royale mode revolves around a tablet that characters can use, seeing a visual representation of where the Danger Zone is closing in as the match progresses.

The tablet can also track the movements of other players and their drone deliveries, allowing you to strategically use this information to your advantage. The tablet can be upgraded to gain more detailed intel on the ever-changing Danger Zone.

item.title: Imperator: Rome Has Deadly Forests and Emergency Dictator Powers
item.description: A trip back into history in Paradox's latest deep strategy game.
item.content:encoded:
Historically, the later period of the Western Roman Empire was heavily shaped by the migration of barbarian Germanic tribes into their former lands, paving the way for medieval states. Imperator: Rome, Paradox’s upcoming grand strategy game about the classical world, starts several centuries earlier than that in a time when Rome was just beginning its rise to power. But when I heard barbarian migrations had been implemented as a launch feature, I didn’t let the date on the calendar stop me from kicking the party off early.

Imperator is based around population units called pops, a concept that may be familiar to players of other Paradox games like Stellaris and Victoria II. These are the people that live in all of the thousands of cities on the map. They can be encouraged to move, they can decline and die, or they can multiply as history marches on. Germanic barbarian tribes have the ability to uproot their pops and turn them into mobile armies, leaving their former homes uninhabited and allowing them to seek new ones.
